security_audit.summary: This is an educational documentation and code generation skill for building MCP servers. The codebase contains evaluation/testing scripts that make network calls to Claude API and can launch MCP server processes - both legitimate behaviors for testing purposes. No malicious patterns, obfuscated code, or data exfiltration detected. All network endpoints are to official Anthropic and service APIs.

content.user_title: Build MCP Servers for External APIs
content.value_statement: Creating MCP servers from scratch requires understanding protocol design, tool naming conventions, and framework-specific patterns. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for building production-ready MCP servers in Python or TypeScript that enable reliable LLM integration with any external service.
actual_capabilities: Guide through 4-phase MCP server development workflow
Implement tools with Python FastMCP or TypeScript MCP SDK
Apply naming conventions and best practices for tool design
Create evaluation tests to verify MCP server effectiveness
Implement pagination, error handling, and response formatting
limitations: This skill provides guidance only - you must write actual server code
Does not host or run MCP servers for you
Does not provide API credentials for target services
Evaluation scripts require your own Anthropic API key

prompt_templates.title: New MCP Project
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create an MCP server for [SERVICE_NAME] API. Walk me through the project setup including package.json/tsconfig.json, server initialization, and the first tool implementation with proper input validation.

prompt_templates.title: Tool Implementation
prompt_templates.prompt: I have an MCP server called [SERVER_NAME]. Add a tool called [TOOL_NAME] that [DESCRIPTION]. Include Pydantic/Zod validation, proper error handling, and markdown/json response formatting.

prompt_templates.title: Evaluation Setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Create 10 evaluation questions in XML format for my [SERVICE] MCP server. Each question should require multiple tool calls, test read-only operations, and have verifiable single-value answers.

prompt_templates.title: Best Practices Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my MCP server code at [FILE_PATH] against the MCP best practices. Check tool naming, annotations, response formats, pagination, error handling, and security considerations. Suggest specific improvements.

output_examples.input: Help me create an MCP server for a GitHub integration using Python FastMCP
output: Project structure created with requirements.txt and server file
First tool: 'github_list_repos' with Pydantic input model
Error handling for API rate limits and authentication
Response formatting with markdown and JSON output options
Next step: Add additional tools for issues and pull requests

best_practices: Use service prefixes in tool names (e.g., 'github_create_issue') to prevent conflicts when multiple MCP servers are loaded
Implement pagination for list operations and return has_more/next_offset metadata to help agents handle large datasets
Set appropriate tool annotations (readOnlyHint, destructiveHint, idempotentHint) to help LLMs understand tool behavior
anti_patterns: Avoid generic tool names like 'search' or 'get' that may conflict with other MCP servers
Do not return entire API responses without filtering - agents can easily run out of context with large payloads
Avoid blocking operations without timeout handling - network calls should use async patterns with reasonable timeouts

faq.question: What programming languages are supported for MCP servers?
faq.answer: This skill covers Python (FastMCP) and TypeScript (MCP SDK). Both are officially supported by Anthropic.

faq.question: What transport should I use for my MCP server?
faq.answer: Use stdio for local integrations and command-line tools. Use Streamable HTTP for remote servers that need to serve multiple clients.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with existing MCP servers?
faq.answer: Yes, the evaluation scripts can test any MCP server that supports stdio, SSE, or HTTP transport connections.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using evaluation scripts?
faq.answer: Evaluation scripts run locally with your API keys. Data is only sent to the Anthropic API you configure and your target service APIs.

faq.question: Why are my MCP tools not working in evaluations?
faq.answer: Common issues include missing authentication, rate limiting, incorrect tool naming, or missing annotations. Review the evaluation feedback for specific guidance.

faq.question: How is this different from using pre-built MCP servers?
faq.answer: This skill helps you build custom MCP servers for APIs that do not have official MCP integrations. You control the tool design and capabilities.
